content.text: Bash scripts are files containing commands that you run in the terminal. They automate tasks and make your work more efficient.
content.html: Bash scripts are files containing commands that you run in the terminal. They automate tasks and make your work more efficient.

content.text: To create a script, start with the shebang #! followed by the path to Bash, usually /bin/bash . Make sure your script has execute permissions.
content.html: To create a script, start with the shebang #! followed by the path to Bash, usually /bin/bash. Make sure your script has execute permissions.

content.code:
#!/bin/bash


# This script prints a greeting message


echo

"Hello, World!"
content.code_html:
#!/bin/bash
# This script prints a greeting message
echo "Hello, World!"

content.text: Variables store data that your script can use. Assign values using the = sign without spaces.
content.html: Variables store data that your script can use. Assign values using the = sign without spaces.

content.code:
#!/bin/bash


# Assign a value to a variable


name
=
"World"


echo

"Hello,
$name
!"
content.code_html:
#!/bin/bash
# Assign a value to a variable
name="World"
echo "Hello, $name!"
